question: 拒む
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>refuse</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to refuse</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: What are you refusing? You are refusing a child, because children are all bad. You say "<reading><ja>子</ja> ba</reading>d, <reading><ja>子</ja> ba</reading>d" over and over again.
